messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Article about saving a marriage
messages.msgSnippet: That s a nice article.  I was uncomfortable about the praying for God to change him.  It s better that he changed himself, and he did.   I like the method,
messages.messageBody:
That's a nice article. I was uncomfortable about the praying for God to change him. It's better that he changed himself, and he did. I like the method, though, and the results, and it's good writing.

Today, Keith and I have been married for 31 years, and it's the 31st. :-)
(Kirby pointed out the 31 part; I wouldn't have thought of it.)

This weekend, our oldest, Kirby, moved back home. He's 28. He's brought his partner and her six-year-old daughter. They plan to be here for many months, maybe a year or years. :-) It's interesting for it to be so open-ended. But the "what can I do to make your day better?" method can work with situations other than just marriage.

Maybe the idea of partnership with a child should include that thought, too, even if the children are little.

Sandra

messages.subject: Article about saving a marriage
